segments.text: I see the woman drying a plate, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge, making the floor slippery and dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’s been like this and why she hasn’t turned off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are distracted too, reaching for cookies like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost like she’s in another world, just focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything around her is going wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s a mess waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should really tell her about the water before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s going to slip and fall if she doesn’t notice soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting to warn her, but she seems so lost in her own little routine.
segments.speaker: PAR
